results.title: Hollow Knight
results.brief_description: Hollow Knight is an award-winning platforming game developed by Australian indie studio Team Cherry.

constellations_primary.name: Silent adventures (Hollow Knight - Education)
constellations_primary.description: Videogames, film and TV usually rely on the spoken word to communicate character and story. It wasn’t always this way. Although we may think of ‘silent films’ as in the past, there are contemporary videogames and films that shy away from using the spoken word.

results.description:
Hollow Knight is an award-winning platforming game developed by Australian indie studio Team Cherry.

Players explore vast underground catacombs of the ruined Hallownest kingdom. Much of the map is locked off to the player in the beginning but becomes accessible after the player finds key objects or gains new or enhanced skills.

Initially created through a successful Kickstarter campaign, Hollow Knight has playful animation, slick game mechanics and a unique gothic aesthetic that has seen it sell over a million copies worldwide.
description_for_label:

results.title: Alt-Right Arabesque
results.brief_description:
Alt-Right Arabesque continues Pailthorpe’s interest in the performing digital body, yet with a new focus on the aesthetics of the resurgent and re-branded fascism (the so-called Alt-right). The sickly-looking protagonist in this work symbolises the infamous 4chan moderator or frequent Reddit user, who spectacularly twirls en arabesque in box-fresh Nike Airmax. A variety of surreal political imagery, visual references and cinematic techniques long associated with fascism and propaganda in the history of cinema are combined in this animation to create a strange and intense response to the overwhelming weirdness of 2016.
[Source: https://sydneycontemporary.com.au/video17/
Last accessed 2/9/2020]

results.title: H.U.R.G. [Spectrum 48K]
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer program. Cassette, manual, cardboard cassette case and plastic cassette tray.
results.brief_description:
“H.U.R.G., High-Level User-Friendly Real-Time Games Designer”, is a program that enables you to create games. It is a menu driven utility designed to assist in creating games for the ZX Spectrum 48K and can be used by those with little or no knowledge of programming. For example, by using the ‘Edit Game’ menu option, the player can select actions such as creating a title page or specifying playing conditions via sub-menus. Utilities like these opened the possibilities for using home computers, by making programming accessible to anyone who was interested. Games created with “H.U.R.G.” are not stand-alone; they still require the engine to run.

“H.U.R.G.” came with three demo games that were created within the engine: ‘Manic Koala’, ‘Egg Pack’ and ‘Ms. Hortense’. Melbourne House ran competitions to encourage people to use “H.U.R.G.” in games design, with cash prizes for the best games created on the software.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/h-u-r-g-high-level-user-friendly-real-time-game-designer/

Last accessed: 5/05/2021

Original game developed by Beam Software. Published in 1984 by Melbourne House.
